author: Special Correspondent
text:
A total of 113 cases were settled for Rs.1.44 crore at the mega Lok Adalat organised at five courts across the district on Saturday.

A majority of the cases pertained to motor vehicle accident disputes which were settled amicably.

P. Ravi, Principal District Judge and Chairman of the District Legal Services Authority, inaugurated the adalat at the District Court here. Similar adalats were conducted simultaneously at the courts in Aranthangi, Alangudi, Keeranur, and Tirumayam.

P. Indrani, secretary of the authority, T.V. Anilkumar, Chief Judicial Magistrate, M. Pitchammal, Special Judge of the Essential Commodities Court, Liaquath Ali, Judge of the Mahila Court, and Sumathy Saipriya, Additional District Judge, presided over the “adalat” in Pudukottai.

At other centres, the judicial magistrates and former judges pursued the documents and arrived at the settlement.
title: 113 cases settled for Rs.1.44 crore
